column4: can some one help me reconfigureing time zones in ubuntu 6.06?
what time zone
tzselect in terminal
does it keep reverting back to a wrong time zone
you can set the time zone in you .profile file
but there si no other way to do it?
what time zone
for example from south georgia to buenos aires/argentina
well do you want to have the same time zone always being used
yes, I want to configure the timezone and, after restart server, mantain that configuration
ok thats an easy fix, what time zone do youlive in currently
ok one second please
add this line to  ~/.profile  at the end "TZ='America/Argentina/Buenos_Aires'; export TZ"
then restart X
I am not using X
no just your user profile
ok well then after you add the line log out than back in
open your file called "/etc/timezone" and see if the correct time zone is there. it should be "America/Argentina/Buenos_Aires"
that is correct tzconfig do that, the problem is when I restart the server.  It is a new server, with nothing instaled but a standard instalation
well something is wrong im not sure of then
thank you ver much any way
